result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Chappell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles Chappell in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Charles Chappell.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Plea Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
 
AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

Court advised defendant if they are not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, they could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 11.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, filed.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Charles Chappell not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is scheduled for plea and sentencing. Defense is asking for additional time for defendant to fill out plea forms. Case is adjourned.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Charles Chappell not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 28.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Charles Chappell in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Defendant Charles Chappell in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

OFF THE RECORD: Parties are not present.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing 2/22/2022. Milwaukee County Office of Emergency Management declared a snow emergency for 2/22/2022 therefore this matter will be rescheduled. A new date has been selected with Attorney Harris by email. Case is adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Charles Chappell not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Charles Chappell not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with
Burger King, 6746 W. Greenfield Avenue, West Allis
Party City, 6718 W. Greenfield Avenue, West Allis
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring with a 24 hour curfew with the exception of dental, medical and legal appointments.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $25,000.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Charles Chappell in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Charles Chappell in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles Chappell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
